Literature Review: Chinese developmental dyslexia (DD) has been a topic of increasing interest in recent years, with a growing body of research shedding light on the language-universal and language-specific mechanisms underlying this complex disorder. This review aims to provide an overview of the recent advances in Chinese DD research, highlighting the converging behavioral evidence and neural abnormalities that distinguish Chinese DD from alphabetic languages. The findings of this review have significant implications for the development of effective intervention programs and further theoretical endeavors to understand the neurobiological mechanisms underlying dyslexia.
